CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Prototype Development stage positioned above or below the Market Release stage?
SRP.A: The Prototype Development stage is positioned {above} the Market Release stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {linear} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Testing and Validation?
VE.A: The value of stage Testing and Validation is {64%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Prototype Development?
VE.A: The value of stage Prototype Development is {82%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Design Phase, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Market Release, with a value of {15%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Prototype Development to stage Testing and Validation?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Prototype Development to stage Testing and Validation is {18%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Design Phase to stage Prototype Development?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Design Phase to stage Prototype Development is {18%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 73%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Design Phase} stage has {100%}, the {Prototype Development} stage has {82%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 38%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Production} stage has {29%}, the {Market Release} stage has {15%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 38% and 55%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Final Design Approval to Production, or from stage Prototype Development to Testing and Validation?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Final Design Approval} to {Production} is equal to the reduction from stage Prototype Development to Testing and Validation.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Final Design Approval to Production, or from stage Testing and Validation to Final Design Approval?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Final Design Approval} to {Production} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Prototype Development to Testing and Validation, from stage Final Design Approval to Production, or from stage Design Phase to Prototype Development?
NC.A: The reductions from stage {Prototype Development} to {Testing and Validation}, {Final Design Approval} to {Production}, and {Design Phase} to {Prototype Development} are equal.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Design Phase} and {Prototype Development} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Production} and {Market Release} stages.
